alert.note: Alert for Butte; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 11:34AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Antelope Creek near Darlington affecting Custer and Butte Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Antelope Creek above Darlington with primary impacts between Bear Creek and Cherry Creek. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding possible along stretches of Antelope Creek from the Grouse area downstream to the Big Lost River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Wednesday was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 06/07/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Antelope Creek Darlington 6.0 6.5 Wed 10 am MD MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
